data.event: The 2011 Census recorded the parish's population as 1,290.
Milton was among a number of estates that Henry VIII granted to Baron Wriothesley in 1546.

event.title: retained it for the next 218 years

data.event: Wriothesley sold Milton that same year to Thomas Calton, a goldsmith of London, whose descendants retained it for the next 218 years.
In 1709 Paul Calton married Catherine, daughter of Admiral John Benbow.

event.title: 1764 Catherine, Martha and Mary Calton sold

data.event: In 1764 Catherine, Martha and Mary Calton sold the estate to Bryant Barrett, in whose family the property remains.
The actual date is unknown: in 1696 it was described as "newly built" but Sir Nikolaus Pevsner believed that it could not be much later than the 1660s.
In 1772 short two-storey wings designed by Stephen Wright were added to the house for Bryant Barrett.
